Question: When a die is thrown
Option_A: find the probability of getting an even number.
Option_B: Total outcomes = 6 (1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6). Favorable outcomes (even numbers) = 3 (2, 4, 6). P(even number) = 3/6 = 1/2. Answer: 1/2

Question: When a coin is tossed
Option_A: find the probability of getting a head.
Option_B: Total outcomes = 2 (Head, Tail). Favorable outcome = 1 (Head). P(Head) = 1/2. Answer: 1/2

Question: When two coins are tossed simultaneously
Option_A: find the probability of getting two heads.
Option_B: Total outcomes = 4 (HH, HT, TH, TT). Favorable outcome = 1 (HH). P(two heads) = 1/4. Answer: 1/4

Question: When two coins are tossed simultaneously
Option_A: find the probability of getting at least one head.
Option_B: Total outcomes = 4 (HH, HT, TH, TT). Favorable outcomes (at least one head) = 3 (HH, HT, TH). P(at least one head) = 3/4. Answer: 3/4

Question: A bag contains 5 red and 3 blue balls. A ball is drawn at random. Find the probability that it is red.
Option_A: Total balls = 5 + 3 = 8. Red balls = 5. P(red ball) = 5/8. Answer: 5/8

Question: A bag contains 5 red and 3 blue balls. A ball is drawn at random. Find the probability that it is blue.
Option_A: Total balls = 8. Blue balls = 3. P(blue ball) = 3/8. Answer: 3/8

Question: When a die is thrown
Option_A: find the probability of getting a prime number.
Option_B: Total outcomes = 6. Prime numbers on a die = 2, 3, 5 (3 numbers). P(prime number) = 3/6 = 1/2. Answer: 1/2

Question: When a die is thrown
Option_A: find the probability of getting a number less than 7.
Option_B: Total outcomes = 6. Numbers less than 7 = 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6 (all 6 numbers). P(number < 7) = 6/6 = 1. Answer: 1

Question: When a card is drawn from a pack of 52 cards
Option_A: find the probability of getting a king.
Option_B: Total cards = 52. Number of kings = 4. P(king) = 4/52 = 1/13. Answer: 1/13

Question: When a card is drawn from a pack of 52 cards
Option_A: find the probability of getting a red card.
Option_B: Total cards = 52. Red cards (hearts + diamonds) = 13 + 13 = 26. P(red card) = 26/52 = 1/2. Answer: 1/2

Question: When a card is drawn from a pack of 52 cards
Option_A: find the probability of getting a face card.
Option_B: Total cards = 52. Face cards (Jack, Queen, King) in each suit = 3. Total face cards = 3 × 4 = 12. P(face card) = 12/52 = 3/13. Answer: 3/13

Question: When a card is drawn from a pack of 52 cards
Option_A: find the probability of getting a spade.
Option_B: Total cards = 52. Spades = 13. P(spade) = 13/52 = 1/4. Answer: 1/4

Question: When two dice are thrown simultaneously
Option_A: find the probability of getting a sum of 7.

Question: When two dice are thrown simultaneously
Option_A: find the probability of getting a sum of 12.
Option_B: Total outcomes = 36. Favorable outcomes (sum = 12): (6,6) = 1. P(sum = 12) = 1/36. Answer: 1/36

Question: When two dice are thrown simultaneously
Option_A: find the probability of getting a doublet.

Question: When two dice are thrown simultaneously
Option_A: find the probability of getting a sum of 2.
Option_B: Total outcomes = 36. Favorable outcomes (sum = 2): (1,1) = 1. P(sum = 2) = 1/36. Answer: 1/36

Question: A box contains 10 red
Option_A: 20 blue
Option_B: and 30 green balls. A ball is drawn at random. Find the probability that it is red.
Option_C: Total balls = 10 + 20 + 30 = 60. Red balls = 10. P(red) = 10/60 = 1/6. Answer: 1/6

Question: A box contains 10 red
Option_A: 20 blue
Option_B: and 30 green balls. A ball is drawn at random. Find the probability that it is blue.
Option_C: Total balls = 60. Blue balls = 20. P(blue) = 20/60 = 1/3. Answer: 1/3

Option_A: find P(not E).

Question: If P(E) = 0.05
Option_A: find P(not E).

Question: When three coins are tossed simultaneously
Option_A: find the probability of getting exactly two heads.
Option_B: Total outcomes = 2³ = 8 (HHH, HHT, HTH, THH, HTT, THT, TTH, TTT). Favorable outcomes (exactly 2 heads) = 3 (HHT, HTH, THH). P(exactly 2 heads) = 3/8. Answer: 3/8

Question: When three coins are tossed simultaneously
Option_A: find the probability of getting at least one head.
Option_B: Total outcomes = 8. Favorable outcomes (at least one head) = 7 (all except TTT). P(at least one head) = 7/8. Answer: 7/8

Question: When three coins are tossed simultaneously
Option_A: find the probability of getting no head.
Option_B: Total outcomes = 8. Favorable outcome (no head) = 1 (TTT). P(no head) = 1/8. Answer: 1/8

Question: In a class of 30 students
Option_A: 18 are girls. If one student is selected at random
Option_B: find the probability that the student is a boy.
Option_C: Total students = 30. Girls = 18. Boys = 30 - 18 = 12. P(boy) = 12/30 = 2/5. Answer: 2/5

Question: When a die is thrown
Option_A: find the probability of getting a number greater than 4.
Option_B: Total outcomes = 6. Numbers greater than 4 = 5, 6 (2 numbers). P(number > 4) = 2/6 = 1/3. Answer: 1/3

Question: When a card is drawn from a pack of 52 cards
Option_A: find the probability of getting a black king.
Option_B: Total cards = 52. Black kings (king of spades, king of clubs) = 2. P(black king) = 2/52 = 1/26. Answer: 1/26

Question: When a card is drawn from a pack of 52 cards
Option_A: find the probability of getting an ace.
Option_B: Total cards = 52. Aces = 4. P(ace) = 4/52 = 1/13. Answer: 1/13

Question: A bag contains 3 red
Option_A: 5 black
Option_B: and 4 white balls. A ball is drawn at random. Find the probability that it is white.
Option_C: Total balls = 3 + 5 + 4 = 12. White balls = 4. P(white) = 4/12 = 1/3. A
